cards.heading: About this Collection
cards.description: In this collection of Chinese antiques, you will find artifacts scanned from the McMaster Museum of Art and the Art Gallery of Hamilton. Collected from two major art institutions in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada, these artifacts explore how colonialism, white supremacy, and orientalism have shaped dominant perceptions of the Asian diaspora.

assets.name: Double Handled Ovoid Ewer
assets.creator: Serena Zen
assets.description: Scanned by Serena at the Mcmaster Museum of Art. This artifact has a sticker still on it from the British Antique Dealers, physical marks of colonialism, trade, international connection.
assets.acknowledgement: Support from the Art Gallery of Hamilton (AGH)

cards.heading: Chen-Style Tai Chi Motion Capture Data
cards.description:
This is a Chen-style Tai Chi motion capture dataset created in collaboration with Jianhua Wu, president of the Hunan branch of the Chen-style Tai Chi Association. The database was captured using Rokoko Vision with two iPhone 13 Pros in Changsha, China, in January 2025.

The movements are based on Chen Tai Chi Old Frame I, including the following postures: Beginning Posture, Vajra Pounds Mortar, Grasp and Tuck Clothes, Six Sealing, Four Closing, Single Whip, Vajra Pounds Mortar, White Goose Spreads Wings, Step Obliquely, Embrace Knee, Shan san bu, Hidden Hand Punch, Vajra Pounds Mortar, Draping Body Fist, Green Dragon Emerges From the Water, Two-Handed Push, Fist Under Elbow, Step Back and Push with Arm, White Goose Spreads Wings, Step Obliquely, Flash the Back, Hidden Hand Punch, Lotus Kick, and Closing.

cards.heading: What is Chen-Style Tai Chi?
cards.description:
Chen-style Tai Chi originated in Chen Jia Gou, Wen County, Henan Province.
Its founder was Chen Wangting.

cards.heading: About the Contributor
cards.description: 'My name is Wu Jianhua. I am the president of the Hunan branch of the Chen Style Tai Chi Association, the deputy secretary-general of the Hunan Martial Arts Association, and the vice president of the Hunan Tai Chi Association'

cards.heading: Behind the Scenes
cards.description: I used Rococo Vision to perform motion capture. Rococo Vision is an accessible AI-powered solution that requires two iPhones. Without the need for a professional motion capture suit, I was able to use this application to capture movement in a local park with a Tai Chi master. As a dual-camera setup, it captures more information, especially when the subject is facing away from the camera. However, the application has some limitations. For instance, the captured movement is not very stable, and the tracking area is limited. Due to these limitations, cleaning the motion capture data in 3D software takes a considerable amount of time. h

assets.name: Beginning Posture
assets.creator: Haoran Chang
assets.description: This Chen-Style Tai Chi movement is called Begining Posture.
assets.acknowledgement: In collaboration with Jianhua Wu. Thanks to my parents and aunt for their support, driving me to the park, lending an extra iPhone, helping set up the equipment and conduct the test, and documenting the process.

cards.heading: About this Collection
cards.description: This collection features 3D models of various fruits commonly found in Asian markets. The models were created using photogrammetry techniques, capturing the intricate details and textures of each fruit. The collection includes a dragon fruit, Asian pear with a sticker, starfruit, and lychee. These fruits are not only visually appealing but also hold cultural significance in Asian cuisine.

assets.name: Dragon Fruit
assets.creator: Serena Zen
assets.description: Scanned at McMaster, bought at nations, Serena always finds this kind of dragons fruit underwhelming, since the outside is so vibrant but it tastes a bit bland.

assets.name: Asian pear with sticker
assets.creator: Serena Zen
assets.description: Purchased from Nations in Hamilton, ON and scanned at McMaster University 2023. Highly coveterd in the early 80's because it was rare to find in the grocery stores out west (Canada).

assets.name: Starfruit (Cross-Section)
assets.creator: Serena Zen
assets.description: Bought at Nations in hamiltonn, on, scanned at mcmaster u 2023. Great to look at (pretty food) moreso than it's taste. S loves the taste. C had a friend thst made paper with it and it was amazing because she ran thin slices (cross sections) through the press and dried - it was translucent in the light.

assets.name: Lychee
assets.creator: Serena Zen
assets.description: Bought at Nations, Hamilton, ON, scanned 2023 at McMaster University. S used to get a giant bag of Lychee at the outdoor market and eat them walking home with a friend in Toronto. A's favorite pop flavour. H- old story in China about a Queen who craved lychee. People had to transport lychee from southern China to northern China, but the horses were exhusted from the constant transport and died. (therefore not technically vegan)

assets.name: Golden Dragon Fruit
assets.creator: Serena Zena
assets.description: Scanned at McMaster University. Purchased from Nations in Hamilton, ON. A rare variety with a sweeter taste than typical dragon fruit.
assets.acknowledgement: 2023 McMaster Food Scanning Party
